titles: Die Veneris, 8 Martii, 1649 Mr. Millington reports from the Committtee [sic] of plundred ministers, the matter of fact touching the book entituled, The doctrine of the Fourth Commandment deformed by popery, reformed and restored to its primitive purity, &c. ...
author: England and Wales. Parliament.
Millington, Gilbert, d. 1666.
publisher: printed by Edward Husband and Iohn Field, printers to the Parliament of England,
notes: An order to burn the book by James Ockford.
Title from caption title and opening words of text.
Year given according to Lady Day dating.
Reproduction of original in the Folger Shakespeare Library.
